pros: steady work, lots of opportunities for the company to grow
cons: boring products, people you work with are not very tech savvy so it takes a lot for a campaign to be successful

pros: They take good care of their permanent employees.
cons: Casual workers are treated differently from their main employees

pros: Stability and non stress environment with confidential salary

review_title: Overall, a great company to work for but very small.
pros:
Small business environment allows you to work closely with the president and vice president of the company. 

A great way to meet important people in the community.
cons:
Little job availability. 

Small town so it is often hard to find things to do after your work day ends.

pros: Schedule is 4-10's with 3 day weekends. Paid time off and sick time is generous.
cons: Management team is hypocritical and doesn't support their employees well. With so many programs, you are asked to do the work of 3-4 people and when someone quits (which is frequent) you are asked to cover their work as well without them replacing the position. I worked there for 3 years and and didn't receive a raise for over 2 years. I ended up leaving due to the need for value in my work ethic.

job_title: Project Manager in Port of Spain
pros: Senior management has a sound and sustainable path for the future of the company and for the people of Trinidad & Tobago.
cons: Changes in government means a change in board members.  Not conducive for a company with a plan that extends beyond the election cycle.

pros: Dynamic workplace, great culture, impactful work.
cons: Not enough time to do everything I want!
